result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore Bernard Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge by 3-18-16. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered. Court ordered all other costs and surcharges WAIVED due to defendant's financial situation.

**Court does not object to expungement in this case if it is determined appropriate after defendant has completed his sentence.**
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Time Served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore Bernard Simmons

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Theodore Bernard Simmons in court with attorney Catherine M. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Defendant ordered to serve 5 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of (5) days - Time Served.
Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory $200.00 DNA surcharge by 3-18-2016.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court ordered all other costs and surcharges WAIVED due to defendant's financial situation. 
Court does not object to expungment in this case if it is determined appropriate after defendant has completed his sentence.  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk jks

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Theodore Bernard Simmons not in court, in custody, Not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case held off the recrod.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Theodore Bernard Simmons in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Theodore Bernard Simmons in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
